name: James Eggeling
text: I have to say that the pizza we had here is fabulous!!!! Our Truffle and Feta pizza was delicious to say the least, love the taste of the truffles and other mushrooms, a real treat for the taste buds, the white sauce and feta cheese ‚Ä¶More

name: Larry Skidmore
text: Staff has always been great in my experience. The food has always hit the spot, especially the ultimate platter (should call it the belly buster for me). I'm a fan of O'Dell's brewery so it makes me happy to have that option on draft here.

name: Rebecca Griffith
text: The service was great! But the salad was a bit over dressed and my husband said the aui shu was pure broth. Other than that, nice place to eat.

name: Carl Walker
text: Good food on all six plates we had.  Only complaint is that my wings were pretty small.

name: Wilfredo Blanco
text: Bostons is a great place to watch the game and get a beer. Lots of different options on the TV. so you can watch your team

name: Amanda Wight
text: Boston's is fantastic with excellent customer service. We tried going to first watch for breakfast to be told it'd be a 20 minute wait for a table for 2, only to end up waiting over an hour and a half. We left and came here, and I'm sure ‚Ä¶More

name: M Gonzales
text: Entered near eleven, it wasn't packed. Certainly worth going back to. Bring your appetite because portions are generous.

name: Joshua Green
text: Absolutely the worse experience. Food was dry which was most likely due to sitting in window. Restaurant was not busy. Server was absolutely terrible. Who doesnt bring you ketchup? What kind of server does tgat. Is that how boston runs ‚Ä¶More

name: Kevin Cochrane
text: Awesome!  GREAT service, GREAT food, GREAT prices,  GREAT atmosphere. We LOVE this place!

name: kenneth burns
text: Good food and service I had the chicken salad and the wife had the steak skewers. Lots of large tvs good atmosphere.

name: SnomaN-
text: Pizzas you've probably not had before and taste really good. Thin crust was a real treat. Atmosphere was what you would expect from a sports bar. I've had better bar pizza before but the beer was poured just right and it was tasty.

name: Clint McKelvey
text: Orders the turkey bacon avacado sandwich off of the lunch menu. It arrived with a tiny piece of burnt bacon. Also the sandwich was tiny as well. Service could have been better.

name: Shirley Richards
text: Love the food and service. Love the Fish and Chips and Salmon

name: Bill Jaromin
text: Excellent food! Excellent bartenders! A must place to visit when in Grand Junction!

name: Jeff Taylor
text: Good burgers and pizza. Good value for your $$.

name: Amanda Goodavish
text: The staff was very friendly and courteous and this place had very clean bathrooms. There are lots of TV's around to catch sports games. Service was prompt and we were asked how our meal was. The pepperoni pizza has a bit of a spice to it, and the plain cheese was pretty good. I'd be happy to try some of their other food items.

name: Cheryl Mattos
text: We had a great late lunch on Sunday of Memorial Day Weekend. As lifelong hospitality people we were very impressed with the organization and attention to detail they were following to comply with all the Covid regulations! Great job making us feel safe while we enjoyed a much missed and delicious meal out! We'll be back soon!

name: Miles Dee
text: Almost gave them a 4 but can't do it. We stopped by for lunch on a Friday. My wife had the lunch menu Sliders & Fries. I had the lunch menu Caesar Salad & 1/2 Turkey, Bacon & Avocado Sandwich. Place wasn't too busy, maybe 60% to 70% ‚Ä¶More

text:
We shared the BBQ Rib meal and the Mama Meata Bow Tie Pasta dish.
The ribs were very meaty, tender and had a good bbq sauce.
The pasta dish was insanely good too. ‚Ä¶More

name: Barbara Huston

name: Christina M. Huerta

text: The waitress brought a one dollar bill & a five dollar bill for change. Can't give a tip with that. It should have been six one dollar bills. I was not giving her a five dollar tip so she didn't get a good tip from me. Her own fault.

name: Robin Acosta
text: Stopped in around 9:30 p.m. after work. Jake gave us excellent service. The pizza was average, wouldn't recommend the wings, the pesto pasta was hot fresh and tasty. The pork and MVB sliders were flavorful. The fries were good.

name: Jeffrey Long
text: Always a great place to eat. The BBQ chicken pizza with cilantro is amazing

name: Shawna Gibson

text: A higher level of bar food with something for everyone. Simple to order wings, excellent entrees, great pizza but the Mediterranean Salad I had was just OK. Good choices for kids. Great service.

name: Joe Kendall

text: My wife and I had lunch here and it was phenomenal!! Great service and even better food!! We haven't been to Boston's in a few years and it has definitely changed for the better.

name: Sandra Gordon
text: Went for happy hour drinks and appetizers after work, it was very busy of course. Our server was very friendly and patient. She had a lot going on but was still able to take great care of us. My only complaint, they no longer carry the Black Magic rum that I usually order.

I would go back if in the area.

name: gina gina
text: The food was great! The variety of the menu was awesome! We went on a busy Saturday evening. Not too much of a wait. When we are back in Grand Junction we will be sure to visit again!

The boneless "wings" aren't wings, they're pretty tiny chicken nuggets, and my 15 count was only 13. I won't rush back to eat there, but I'd return eventually.
